personal.name: Adyan Zaman
personal.title: Computer Science and Engineering Student
personal.bio: Hi, I’m Adyan Zaman, a passionate Computer Science and Engineering student at UC Merced. My journey is driven by a love for coding, problem-solving, and exploring the world of technology. From building software solutions to leading innovative projects, I strive to push boundaries and create meaningful impact. Outside of academics, I’m also an enthusiast of basketball, running, fitness, and good food – especially lobster!

projects.title: Software Development Lead - Farm-ng
projects.description: Developed a specialized attachment for the Farm Robotics Challenge to minimize crop yield loss due to growth irregularities. Engineered a Rest API for managing data and instructions, optimizing a seed-drilling machine for enhanced planting.

projects.title: Software Developer - Team Cartographer (NASA S.U.I.T.S)
projects.description: Development in LMCC (Local Mission Control Console) Team as part of the 2024 NASA S.U.I.T.S Challenge. Learning and Implementing A* Search Algorithm using Python and Unity, gaining skills with the utilization of git.

projects.title: RFD - Reconnaissance Fire Drone - Team Lead
projects.description: Led and constructed a drone with the purpose of facilitating a search and rescue with a team of student engineers for experience. Employed Arduino, C++, and Fusion 360 for drone testing and development, advancing firefighting technology knowledge.
